text: The 1976 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in Monteroni di Lecce, Italy in 1976.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Due to the 1976 Summer Olympics only seven events were contested, 5 for men (3 for professionals, 2 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | John-Michael Nicholson || Giordano Turrini || Yoshikazu Sugata |- | | Francesco Moser || Roy Schuiten || Knut Knudsen |- |Men's motor-paced | Wilfried Peffgen || Cees Stam || Walter Avogradi |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- |Men's motor-paced | Gaby Minneboo || Bartolome Caldentey || Rainer Podlesch |- |Men's tandem | Benedykt Kocot Janusz Kotlinski || Ivan Kucirek Milos Jelinek || Anatoly Iablunowsky Vladimir Semenets |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Sheila Young |Sue Novara |Iva Zajícková |- |Women's individual pursuit |Keetie van Oosten-Hage |Luigina Bissoli |Mary Jane Reoch |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1976 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by Italy Category:1976 in track cycling
title: 1976 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
